text.section:
A boxer, kick boxer, or mixed martial arts contestant shall be allowed to enter the ring only if:
a physician approved by the Commission declares the boxer, kick boxer, or mixed martial arts contestant to be physically fit; and
the boxer, kick boxer, or mixed martial arts contestant has complied with § 4-304.1 of this subtitle.

Each boxer, kick boxer, or mixed martial arts contestant in a contest shall submit to a chemical test of the urine of the boxer, kick boxer, or mixed martial arts contestant to detect the presence of a controlled dangerous substance defined in § 5-101 of the Criminal Law Article or other substance that the Commission prohibits by regulation.
The Commission shall set the length in rounds of each boxing, kick boxing, and mixed martial arts contest.

section.section: The Commission shall adopt regulations to ensure the safety of individuals who participate in amateur or professional mixed martial arts contests.

In developing the regulations, the Commission shall consider:
appropriate limits on acceptable maneuvers;
time limits for contest rounds; and
rules for termination of a contest.
